{"step_by_step_thinking": "Gutta-percha is a material commonly used in dentistry for root canal filling. Let's evaluate each statement one by one to determine which one is false. A. It contains 60-70% gutta-percha and 20% ZnO. This statement is true as gutta-percha is the main component of gutta-percha cones used in root canal treatment, and ZnO is often added as a filler. B. Can be sterilized by heating. This statement is true as gutta-percha can be sterilized by heating, which is a common method used in dental practice. C. With time they become brittle. This statement is true as gutta-percha can become brittle over time due to oxidation and aging. D. It has two forms α and β. This statement is true as gutta-percha exists in two crystalline forms, α and β. Therefore, the false statement is A. It contains 60-70% gutta-percha and 20% ZnO.", "answer_choice": "A"}
